definition: widely spread/widely rumored/stories abound/(sb's exploits are) widely circulated
to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: Juts a joke, don't get too serious.
sentences.chinese: 一篇在硅谷盛传的笑话，你以为你老板在想啥？

sentences.english: But beyond this, little of the advice proliferating on the internet is backed by any evidence.
sentences.chinese: 但除此之外，互联网上盛传的建议很少有理论依据。

sentences.english: It is a pity because recently rumours that female the ghost begging meters of water, avoid gossip mirror hung the boss.
sentences.chinese: 可惜因为近日盛传女鬼乞米水，老板挂着八卦镜防避。

sentences.english: The whole sports world is ringing with the wonderful performances by the twin brothers.
sentences.chinese: 整个体育界盛传着这一对孪生兄弟的出色表演。

sentences.english: The"charm"is the widely known cause for Guan Hanqing s Gongan dramas.
sentences.chinese: “魅力”是关汉卿公案剧盛传不衰的主要原因。

sentences.english: Stigma and misinformation are rife. Treatment is expensive.
sentences.chinese: 患病倍感羞辱，错误信息盛传，疾病治疗昂贵。

sentences.english: The novels written by "Poems on Red Leaf" in the Tang & Five Dynasties have long enjoyed popularity since their emergence.
sentences.chinese: 唐五代“红叶题诗”小说自它产生之日起便盛传不衰。

sentences.english: Dragon boat racing will be headed in the world.
Widely rumored in the industry, "World Musketeers" is almost a monthly profit of tens of millions.
sentences.chinese: 业内盛传《剑侠世界》现盈利每月已近千万。

definition: it is rumored that .../it is reported that ...
to get round fast/to spread like wildfire
see 盡人皆知|尽人皆知[jin4 ren2 jie1 zhi1]
to burst out/to appear unexpectedly/to break (media story)
(of video clips, rumors etc) to circulate on the Internet
